java112.analyzer

Class KeywordAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java112.analyzer.KeywordAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Analyzer

    public class KeywordAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Analyzer
    The Keyword Analyzer Class will determine where keywords are in the input file.
    Author:
    sschwert

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KeywordAnalyzer()
      empty constructor for KeywordAnalyzer class instantiates the TreeMap
      KeywordAnalyzer(java.util.Properties properties)
      constructor for KeywordAnalyzer class calles the empty constructor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void generateKeywords(java.lang.String[] keywords)
      the generateKeywords method tests whether the keyword exitsts and adds the keyword (as a key) and a new empty ArrayList (as a value) to the keywordMap
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getKeywordMap()
      This is the get method for the keywordMap instance variable
      void printKeywordReport(java.io.PrintWriter writer)
      the printKeywordReport method formats the output, loops through the map one entry at a time writes the keyword to the output file, and for each time through loops through the arrayLists (map values) and outputs each token entry occurence one at a time so that the program doesn't have to save the output in memory before writing it.
      void processToken(java.lang.String token)
      The process token method is from the interface and will test the tokens/words as they arrive from AnalyzeFile and check to see if it is one of the keywords in the properties file and put it into and Arraylist and call the determinePosition() method
      void readKeywordFile()
      the readKeywordFile method opens, reads, calls the splitFile method, and closes the properties file which contains a list of keywords Then calls the generateKeywords method and passes it each new keyword
      void writeOutputFile(java.lang.String inputFilePath)
      The writeOutputFile method is from the interface and will call the method that will call the printKeywordReport method which creates a file containing a report of each keyword and where it occurs in the file The output file path is obtained from the properties file

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • processToken

        public void processToken(java.lang.String token)
        The process token method is from the interface and will test the tokens/words as they arrive from AnalyzeFile and check to see if it is one of the keywords in the properties file and put it into and Arraylist and call the determinePosition() method
        Specified by:
        processToken in interface Analyzer
        Parameters:
        word - a String that is a single token from AnalyzeFile

      • readKeywordFile

        public void readKeywordFile()
        the readKeywordFile method opens, reads, calls the splitFile method, and closes the properties file which contains a list of keywords Then calls the generateKeywords method and passes it each new keyword
        Parameters:
        inputFilePath - a String, the path of a file that is input at the command line

      • generateKeywords

        public void generateKeywords(java.lang.String[] keywords)
        the generateKeywords method tests whether the keyword exitsts and adds the keyword (as a key) and a new empty ArrayList (as a value) to the keywordMap
        Parameters:
        keywords - is an array of Strings that holds keywords from the readKeywordFile method

      • writeOutputFile

        public void writeOutputFile(java.lang.String inputFilePath)
        The writeOutputFile method is from the interface and will call the method that will call the printKeywordReport method which creates a file containing a report of each keyword and where it occurs in the file The output file path is obtained from the properties file
        Specified by:
        writeOutputFile in interface Analyzer
        Parameters:
        inputFilePath - String for the input file path from the command line

      • getKeywordMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getKeywordMap()
        This is the get method for the keywordMap instance variable
        Returns:
        keywordMap, a Map that represents the keyword and where it occurs in the input file

      • printKeywordReport

        public void printKeywordReport(java.io.PrintWriter writer)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        the printKeywordReport method formats the output, loops through the map one entry at a time writes the keyword to the output file, and for each time through loops through the arrayLists (map values) and outputs each token entry occurence one at a time so that the program doesn't have to save the output in memory before writing it.
        Parameters:
        writer - is a PrintWriter
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - from the print writer, to be dealt with later...
